data.text:
With the recent passing of actors from Hollywood's Golden Age and the various Award Shows now honouring them, my thoughts turned to those, as of this writing, still with us. I thought we might showcase some of those actors 90 and above and spotlight one of their past memorable characters.

Treasured Images Special Edition: Enduring Stars Part 1

Mary Carlisle - Born February 3, 1914 - Present age 103

Motion Pictures include: Grand Hotel (1932), College Humor (1933), The Sweetheart of Sigma Chi (1933), East of Fifth Avenue (1933), This Side of Heaven (1934), Murder in the Private Car (1934), Million Dollar Ransom (1934), Girl O' My Dreams (1934), Kind Lady (1935), Double or Nothing (1937), Tip-Off Girls (1938), Doctor Rhythm (1938), Illegal Traffic (1938), Dance, Girl, Dance (1940) and Rags to Riches (1941).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Mary Carlisle (February 3, 1914 - August 1, 2018) R.I.P.

Norman Lloyd - Born November 8, 1914 - Present age 103

Motion Pictures include: Saboteur (1942), The Southerner (1945), Spellbound (1945), A Walk in the Sun (1945), Reign of Terror (1949), Limelight (1952), Audrey Rose (1972), Dead Poets Society (1982) and The Age of Innocence (1993).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Norman Lloyd (November 8, 1914 - May 11, 2021) R.I.P.

Patricia Morison - Born March 19, 1915 - Present age 102

Motion Pictures include: Untamed (1940), The Fallen Sparrow (1943), Calling Dr. Death (1943), The Song of Bernadette (1943), Lady on a Train (1945), Dressed to Kill (1946), Song of the Thin Man (1947) and Song Without End (1960).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Patricia Morrison (March 19, 1915 - May 20, 2018) R.I.P.

Olivia de Havilland - Born July 1, 1916 - Present age 101

Motion Pictures include: A Midsummer Night's Dream (1935), Captain Blood (1935), The Charge of the Light Brigade (1936), The Adventures of Robin Hood (1938), Dodge City (1939), The Private Lives of Elizabeth and Essex (1939), Gone with the Wind (1939), They Died with Their Boots On (1941), Devotion (1946), The Snake Pit (1948), The Heiress (1949) and Hush... Hush, Sweet Charlotte (1964).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Olivia de Havilland (July 1, 1916 - July 26, 2020) R.I.P.

Kirk Douglas - Born December 9, 1916 - Present age 101

Motion Pictures include: Out of the Past (1947), Champion (1949), Ace in the Hole (1951), Detective Story (1951), The Bad and the Beautiful (1952), Lust for Life (1956), Gunfight at the O.K. Corral (1957), Paths of Glory (1957), Spartacus (1960), Lonely Are the Brave (1962), Seven Days in May (1964) and The Man from Snowy River (1982).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Kirk Douglas (December 9, 1916 - February 5, 2020) R.I.P.

Marsha Hunt - Born October 17, 1917 - Present age 100

Motion Pictures include: Born to the West (1937), Pride and Prejudice (1940), Kid Glove Killer (1942), The Human Comedy (1943), Cry 'Havoc' (1943), The Valley of Decision (1945), Raw Deal (1948), The Happy Time (1952) and Johnny Got His Gun (1971).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Marsha Hunt (October 17, 1917 - September 6, 2022) R.I.P.

Fay McKenzie - Born February 19, 1918 - Present age 99

Motion Pictures include: The Dramatic Life of Abraham Lincoln (1924), Death Rides the Range (1939), Sierra Sue (1941), Cowboy Serenade (1942), Heart of the Rio Grande (1942) and The Party (1968).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Faye McKenzie (February 19, 1918 - April 16, 2019) R.I.P.

Nehemiah Persoff - Born August 2, 1919 - Present age 98

Motion Pictures include: The Harder They Fall (1956), The Wrong Man (1956), Men in War (1957), Some Like It Hot (1959), Al Capone (1959), Day of the Outlaw (1959), The Comancheros (1961), Fate Is the Hunter (1965), Panic in the City (1968), Red Sky at Morning (1971), Voyage of the Damned (1976), Yentl (1983) and The Last Temptation of Christ (1988).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Nehemiah Persoff (August 2, 1919 - April 5, 2022) R.I.P.

Marge Champion - Born September 2, 1919 - Present age 98

Motion Pictures include: Show Boat (1951), Lovely to Look At (1952), Jupiter's Darling (1955), Three for the Show (1955), The Party (1968) and The Swimmer (1968).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Marge Champion (September 2, 1919 - October 21, 2020) R.I.P.

Nanette Fabray - Born October 27, 1920 - Present age 97

Motion Pictures include: The Private Lives of Elizabeth and Essex (1939), The Bandwagon (1953), The Happy Ending (1969) and Harper Valley P.T.A. (1978).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Nanette Fabray (October 27, 1920 - February 22, 2018) R.I.P.

Carl Reiner - Born March 20, 1922 - Present age 95

Motion Pictures include: The Thrill of It All (1963), It's a Mad Mad Mad Mad World (1963), The Russians Are Coming! The Russians Are Coming! (1966), The Comic (1969), Dead Men Don't Wear Plaid (1982) and Ocean's Eleven (2001).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Carl Reiner (March 20, 1922 - June 29, 2020) R.I.P.

Doris Day - Born April 3, 1922 - Present age 95

Motion Pictures include: Young Man with a Horn (1950), Storm Warning (1951), Calamity Jane (1953), Love Me or Leave Me (1955), The Man Who Knew Too Much (1956), Julie (1956), The Pajama Game (1957), Pillow Talk (1959), Please Don't Eat the Daisies (1960), The Thrill of It All (1963) and Send Me No Flowers (1964).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Doris Day (April 3, 1922 â€“ May 13, 2019) R.I.P.

Bill Macy - Born May 18, 1922 - Present age 95

Motion Pictures include: The Late Show (1977), The Jerk (1979), My Favorite Year (1982), Analyze This (1999) and The Holiday (2006).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Bill Macy (May 18, 1922 - October 17, 2019) R.I.P.

Janis Paige - Born September 16, 1922 - Present age 95

Motion Pictures include: Of Human Bondage (1946), Cheyenne (1947), The Younger Brothers (1949), The House Across the Street (1949), This Side of the Law (1950), Two Gals and a Guy (1951), Silk Stockings (1951), Please Don't Eat the Daisies (1960) and Welcome to Hard Times (1967).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Gloria Henry (April 2, 1923 - April 3, 2021) R.I.P.

Rhonda Fleming - Born August 10, 1923 - Present age 94

Motion Pictures include: Spellbound (1945), The Spiral Staircase (1946), Out of the Past (1947), Cry Danger (1951), Inferno (1953), The Killer Is Loose (1956), Slightly Scarlet (1956), While the City Sleeps (1956), Gunfight at the O.K. Corral (1957) and Alias Jesse James (1959).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Rhonda Fleming (August 10, 1923 - October 14, 2020) R.I.P.

Charles Aznavour - Born May 22, 1924 - Present age 93

Motion Pictures include: Shoot the Piano Player (1960), The Fabiani Affair (1962), Destination Rome (1963), The Heist (1970), The Games (1970), Ten Little Indians (1974), Sky Riders (1976), The Tin Drum (1979), Mangeclous (1988), The Comedian (1997) and The Colonel (2006).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Charles Aznavour (May 22, 1924 - October 1, 2018) R.I.P.

Eva Marie Saint - Born July 4, 1924 - Present age 93

Motion Pictures include: On the Waterfront (1954), A Hatful of Rain (1957), North by Northwest (1959), All Fall Down (1962), 36 Hours (1964), The Russians Are Coming! The Russians Are Coming! (1966), Grand Prix (1966), The Stalking Moon (1968), Loving (1970) and I Dreamed of Africa (2000).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Richard Erdman (June 1, 1925 - March 16, 2019) R.I.P.

June Lockhart - Born June 25, 1925 - Present age 92

Motion Pictures include: All This, and Heaven Too (1940), Sergeant York (1941), Meet Me in St. Louis (1944), Son of Lassie (1945), Bury Me Dead (1947), T-Men (1947), Time Limit (1957), Lassie's Great Adventure (1963), Strange Invaders (1983) and Lost in Space (1998).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Angela Lansbury (October 16, 1925 - October 11, 2022) R.I.P.

Dick Van Dyke - Born December 13, 1925 - Present age 92

Motion Pictures include: Bye Bye Birdie (1963), What a Way to Go! (1964), Mary Poppins (1964), Divorce American Style (1967), Fitzwilly (1967), Never a Dull Moment (1968), Chitty Chitty Bang Bang (1968), The Comic (1969), Cold Turkey (1971), The Runner Stumbles (1979), Dick Tracy (1990) and Night at the Museum (2006).

Michel Piccoli - Born December 27, 1925 - Present age 92

Motion Pictures include: French Cancan (1955), Bad Liasons (1955), The Crucible (1957), Rendezvous (1961), Le Doulos (1963), Contempt (1963), Diary of a Chambermaid (1964), Le coup de grÃ¢ce (1965), La voleuse (1966), Is Paris Burning (1966), The Young Girls of Rochefort (1967), Belle de Jour (1967), Danger: Diabolik (1968), The Milky Way (1969), Topaz (1969), The Things of Life (1970), Max and the Junkmen (1971), The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie (1972), CÃ©sar and Rosalie (1972), La Grande Bouffe (1973), The Phantom of Liberty (1974), Vincent, FranÃ§ois, Paul and the Others (1974), Mado (1976), L'Ã©tat sauvage (1978), Atlantic City (1980), Divertimento (1992), Passion in the Desert (1997), Magic Mirror (2005), Beneath the Rooftops of Paris (2007) and We Have a Pope (2011).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Michel Piccoli (December 27, 1925 - May 12, 2020) R.I.P.

Jane Withers - Born April 12, 1926 - Present age 91

Motion Pictures include: Bright Eyes (1934), The Farmer Takes a Wife (1935), The North Star (1943), Danger Street (1947), Giant (1956) and Captain Newman, M.D. (1963).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Jane Withers (April 12, 1926 - August 7, 2021) R.I.P.

Gloria Jean - Born April 14, 1926 - Present age 91

Motion Pictures include: If I Had My Way (1940), A Little Bit of Heaven (1940), Never Give a Sucker an Even Break (1941), When Johnny Comes Marching Home (1942), Moonlight in Vermont (1943), Ghost Catchers (1944), Destiny (1944), I'll Remember April (1945), River Gang (1945), Copacabana (1947) and The Ladies Man (1961).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Gloria Jean (April 14, 1926 - August 31, 2018) R.I.P.

Marilyn Knowlden - Born May 12, 1926 - Present age 91

Motion Pictures include: The Cisco Kid (1931), Little Women (1933), Imitation of Life (1934), David Copperfield (1935), Les MisÃ©rables (1935), Show Boat (1936), Anthony Adverse (1936), Marie Antoinette (1938), Angels with Dirty Faces (1938), Hidden Power (1939), The Way of All Flesh (1940) and All This, and Heaven Too (1940).

Mel Brooks - Born June 28, 1926 - Present age 91

Motion Pictures include: The Twelve Chairs (1970), Blazing Saddles (1974), Silent Movie (1976), High Anxiety (1977), To Be or Not to Be (1983), Spaceballs (1987), Life Stinks (1991) and Robin Hood: Men in Tights (1993).

John Ericson - Born September 25, 1926 - Present age 91

Motion Pictures include: The Student Prince (1954), Green Fire (1954), Bad Day at Black Rock (1955), The Cruel Tower (1956), Forty Guns (1957), Day of the Badman (1958), Pretty Boy Floyd (1960), 7 Faces of Dr. Lao (1964), The Money Jungle (1967), Bedknobs and Broomsticks (1971) and Primary Target (1990).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of John Ericson (September 25, 1926 - May 3, 2020) R.I.P.

Harry Belafonte - Born March 1, 1927 - Present age 90

Motion Pictures include: Carmen Jones (1954), Island in the Sun (1957), The World, the Flesh and the Devil (1959), Odds Against Tomorrow (1959), The Angel Levine (1970), Buck and the Preacher (1972), Uptown Saturday Night (1974), White Man's Burden (1995), Kansas City (1996) and Bobby (2006).

#Edit: Sadly, we mourn the passing of Harry Belafonte (March 1, 1927 - April 25, 2023) R.I.P.

Estelle Parsons - Born November 20, 1927 - Present age 90

Motion Pictures include: Ladybug Ladybug (1963), Bonnie and Clyde (1967), Rachel, Rachel (1968), I Walk the Line (1970), I Never Sang for My Father (1970), For Pete's Sake (1974), Dick Tracy (1990) and That Darn Cat (1997).
